label: Thesaurus categories
definition: Characteristics applicable to entire controlled vocabularies.  We expect these terms to help people decide which vocabularies to use for particular purposes in the absence of official guidance.

children.label: (structure and function)
children.definition: Characteristics of vocabularies like hierarchy, transitivity, granularity that might be used by automated processes to make decisions.

children.label: (generality)
children.definition: Nature of the terms: types or instances

children.label: ambiguous labels
children.definition: A given preferred label may be used for more than one concept in the thesaurus. A concept must be specified using its unique identifier (code). This may occur in the names of places or people.

children.label: distinct labels
children.definition: Preferred labels (descriptor texts) are distinct within the thesaurus. A concept can be specified either by its unique identifier (code) or by the text of its descriptor.

children.label: instances
children.definition: Terms are named instances of things rather than types

children.label: types
children.definition: Terms are types of things rather than named instances

children.label: (hierarchy)
children.definition: Terms are arranged with broader and narrower relationships specified explicitly.

children.label: flat
children.definition: The vocabulary consists of a list of terms that are of roughly equal generality. This applies also in the case where a single broader term serves as parent to the entire vocabulary.

children.label: hierarchical
children.definition: Substantive broader-narrower relationships exist among the terms.

children.label: polyhierarchical
children.definition: Terms are arranged in hierarchy and some terms may have more than one broader term.

children.label: pseudohierarchical
children.definition: Broader-narrower relationships exist in the vocabulary but have no semantic relation to the terms themselves, for example, a list of peoples' names arranged hierarchically by the first letter of the surname.

children.label: (transitivity)
children.definition: Hierarchical relationships may be intentionally transitive or not transitive; automated processes may use this characteristic to compose collections of relevant documents indexed using the vocabulary.

children.label: not transitive
children.definition: Narrower terms cannot reliably be understood as parts of, types of, or instances of the terms that are broader than them.

children.label: transitive
children.definition: Narrower terms have an "is a" relationship with their broader terms, and generally can be described as part-of, type-of, or instance-of the broader term.

children.label: (subjects)
children.definition: Distinct segments of human knowledge, such as place, time, or theme.

children.label: disciplines
children.definition: Broad categories of human inquiry or activity, such as scientific disciplines.

children.label: information representation
children.definition: Terms indicating the content, format, or packaging of information that may be available.

children.label: information format
children.definition: Terms indicating the format in which information is made available.

children.label: information product types
children.definition: Terms categorizing information products by the content, intended use or audience, or formality.

children.label: methods
children.definition: Actions taken to obtain or analyze information

children.label: organizational functions
children.definition: Things that organizations do, typically including various types of programs, projects, and services.

children.label: organizations
children.definition: Terms specify human organizations, their subdivisions and relationships, as well as characteristics of such organizations.

children.label: persons
children.definition: Terms specify individual people, typically by name.

children.label: place
children.definition: Terms indicate extent in space, typically by reference as the names of geographic areas known from information that is stored elsewhere.

children.label: stratum
children.definition: Terms indicating packages of earth materials that have a common characteristic such as age, composition, mode of formation or deformation.

children.label: temporal
children.definition: Terms indicate periods of time, such as chronostratigraphic units, named historical periods or intervals surrounding known historical events, or seasons.

children.label: theme
children.definition: Terms indicate domains of human concern, such as scientific discipline, societal problems, or characteristics of earth, space, oceans, and living things.

children.label: biological taxonomy
children.definition: Terms indicate groups of organisms identified by names where the rules governing the specification and use of the names are defined by well known tradition or by governing bodies such as international commissions.

children.label: lithology
children.definition: Rock types; may be further divided by composition, texture, mode of formation, or physical form of the rock body.
